metadata.title: CVE-2014-0067 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The "make check" command for the test suites in PostgreSQL 9.3.3 andearlier does not properly invoke initdb to specify the authenticationrequirements for a database cluster to be used for the tests, which allowslocal users to gain privileges by leveraging access to this cluster.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libecpg6 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libpq5 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

postgresql-plperl-9.1 - 9.1.15-0ubuntu0.14.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
postgresql-9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.1.15-0ubuntu0.14.04').
